I'm proud that Illinois raised their minimum wage this year. Now it's time to make sure all Americans are making a living wage.

The buying power of today‚Äôs minimum wage is diminishing year after year. In 1968 the buying power of the minimum wage was 31% higher than it is today. This is detrimental to our economy and the livelihoods of Americans.

In Kentucky, where voter suppression is enshrined in state law, we saw voters in Tuesday‚Äôs primary forced to seek a court injunction to allow them to vote after the appallingly early 6 PM poll closure time.

Alabama & Mississippi followed suit w/ their own voter ID laws. North Carolina passed an omnibus election law that gutted early voting and included strict photo ID requirements. This law was later struck down by a federal court because it was passed with a discriminatory purpose

7 years ago today, in Shelby County v. Holder, SCOTUS significantly weakened the Voting Rights Act and struck down a provision that required jurisdictions with a history of discrimination to ‚Äúpre-clear‚Äù changes to their election rules with the federal government.
